newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony unit sees 97/98 game shipments of 31.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: Sony unit sees 97/98 game shipments of 31.5 mln.

text.p: Sony Computer Entertainment Inc said on Thursday that it expected total global shipments of 32-bit PlayStation videogame machines to reach 31.5 million units at the end of March 1998, compared with global shipments of 16 million units at the end of May.

"Accumulated global shipments of PlayStation at the end of March reached 13.5 million units and we plan to produce 18 million machines in the 1997/98 business year. Our total shipments at the end of March 1998 will be the combination of the two," a Sony Computer spokeswoman said.
"Sales of PlayStation are very brisk," she added.
Sony Computer is a 50-50 joint venture of Sony Corp and Sony Music Entertainment (Japan) Inc.
